intro: Melancranis zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's melanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, hairy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
